title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: outlines propose change glyvis. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ‚Äôll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: want make bigger change, ‚Äôs good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ‚Äôs needed. ‚Äôve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven‚Äôt done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glyvis", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn‚Äôt pass cleanly, ‚Äôs good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.¬†just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don‚Äôt restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: Please note glyvis project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with glyvis
text: Thanks using glyvis! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with glyvis
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven‚Äôt heard used reprex , ‚Äôre treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty incredible ROI five ten minutes ‚Äôll take learn ‚Äôs ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with glyvis
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ‚Äôs question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ‚Äôs bug: ‚Äôre right place, file issue. ‚Äôre sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn‚Äôt reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g.¬†:pr, :closed) needed. example, ‚Äôd simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with glyvis
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn‚Äôt worry don‚Äôt get immediate response. Typically don‚Äôt look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ‚Äôs burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can‚Äôt reproduce bug, can‚Äôt fix !

title: Get Started with glyvis
text: Think glyvis versatile artist two distinct painting styles: autoplot() ‚Äî intelligent assistant automatically crafts suitable plots glystats results plot_xxx() ‚Äî precision toolkit creating specific visualizations exactly envision Let‚Äôs see action. create PCA plot, can take direct route plot_pca() exp data:  Alternatively, can take analytical pathway: first conducting PCA analysis glystats::gly_pca(), letting autoplot() work magic statistical results.  first approach gets quickly, second pathway unlocks world possibilities results. gain access underlying statistical objects advanced analyses, can craft custom ggplot2 masterpieces tailored publications. beauty autoplot() lies versatility‚Äîspeaks fluent glystats across nearly every analysis type. Explore complete reference discover full spectrum autoplot() capabilities specialized plot_xxx() functions.
code: plot_pca(exp) pca_res <- gly_pca(exp) autoplot(pca_res)

title: Get Started with glyvis
text: Let‚Äôs set expectations straight: glyvis isn‚Äôt publication graphics department. Creating truly stunning, publication-ready figures art form demands thoughtful customization. Every compelling visualization emerges careful consideration countless decisions: Focus: story data want tell? Scale: much visual real estate make message shine without overwhelming? Layout: can multiple plots dance together harmoniously? Palette: colors captivate staying true data? Annotation: labels text guide reader‚Äôs eye? Polish: devil‚Äôs details‚Äîlegends, fonts, ticks, axes, grids‚Ä¶ creative choices flow intimate knowledge data scientific context. glyvis doesn‚Äôt presume make artistic decisions . Instead, think glyvis data exploration companion. excels born : transforming glystats results instant, informative visuals. ‚Äôs first glimpse data‚Äôs soul, helping spot patterns generate hypotheses speed thought.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bin Fu. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Fu B (2026). glyvis: Fast Visualization Glycoverse. R package version 0.5.0.9000, https://glycoverse.github.io/glyvis/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {glyvis: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse},   author = {Bin Fu},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.5.0.9000},   url = {https://glycoverse.github.io/glyvis/}, }

title: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse
text: goal glyvis visualize everything glycoverse ecosystem. Visualization essential part data analysis. Human beings sensitive visual information text numbers. Plotting helps us understand data better. glyvis provides unified interface visualizing glycoverse data, including statistical results, experiments, glycan biosynthesis pathways, . implements autoplot() method various glycoverse data structures. Just autoplot() !

title: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse
text: can install latest release glyvis r-universe: GitHub: install development version:
code: install.packages('glyvis', repos = c('https://glycoverse.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("glycoverse/glyvis@*release") remotes::install_github("glycoverse/glyvis")

title: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse
text: üöÄ Get started: üìö Reference:

title: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse
text: main purpose glyvis provide visualization glystats results. implements autoplot() methods result class glystats, users can visualize results directly get quick overview. also provides visualization functions glycoverse data structures, glyexp::experiment(), glyrepr::glycan_structure(), others. package intended produce publication-quality figures, provide quick exploration data.

title: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse
code: library(glyexp) library(glyclean) #>  #> Attaching package: 'glyclean' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     aggregate library(glystats) library(glyvis)  exp <- auto_clean(real_experiment) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Normalizing data ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ No QC samples found. Using default normalization method based on experiment type. #> ‚Ñπ Experiment type is "glycoproteomics". Using `normalize_median()`. #> ‚úî Normalization completed. #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Removing variables with too many missing values ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ No QC samples found. Using all samples. #> ‚Ñπ Applying preset "discovery"... #> ‚Ñπ Total removed: 24 (0.56%) variables. #> ‚úî Variable removal completed. #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Imputing missing values ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ No QC samples found. Using default imputation method based on sample size. #> ‚Ñπ Sample size <= 30, using `impute_sample_min()`. #> ‚úî Imputation completed. #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Aggregating data ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ Aggregating to "gfs" level #> ‚úî Aggregation completed. #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Normalizing data again ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ No QC samples found. Using default normalization method based on experiment type. #> ‚Ñπ Experiment type is "glycoproteomics". Using `normalize_median()`. #> ‚úî Normalization completed. #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Correcting batch effects ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚Ñπ Batch column  not found in sample_info. Skipping batch correction. #> ‚úî Batch correction completed.  pca_res <- gly_pca(exp) autoplot(pca_res)

title: Plots for Experiments ‚Äî autoplot.glyexp_experiment
text: Visualization glyexp::experiment() (glyexp_experiment object). Possible types plots: "heatmap": (Default) Expression heatmap columns samples rows variables. "boxplot": Boxplot expression values sample.

title: Plots for Experiments ‚Äî autoplot.glyexp_experiment
code: # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' autoplot(object, type = "heatmap", group_col = "group", ...)

title: Plots for Experiments ‚Äî autoplot.glyexp_experiment
text: object glyexp_experiment object. type type plot, one "heatmap" (default) "boxplot". group_col character string specifying find group information. column sample information tibble. Defaults "group". applicable "boxplot". ... Ignored.

Possible types plots: "dotplot" (default): Dotplot showing p-value, gene counts, gene ratios. "barplot": Barplot showing p-values gene counts. "network": Network plot showing terms relationships.

title: Plots for Limma Result ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_limma_res
text: object glystats_limma_res object. contrast character string specifying contrast plot, format "group1_vs_group2". Must one contrasts result. one contrast (two-group comparison), can NULL (default). log2fc_cutoff log2 fold change cutoff. Defaults 1. p_cutoff p-value cutoff. Defaults 0.05. p_col column name p-value. Defaults "p_adj". Can also "p_val" (raw p-values without multiple testing correction). ... arguments passed underlying functions.

title: Plots for Limma Result ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_limma_res
text: ggplot object.

title: Plots for OPLS-DA ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_oplsda_res
text: Visualization results glystats::gly_oplsda() (glystats_oplsda_res object). Possible types plots: "scores" (default): Plot scores samples. "loadings": Plot loadings variables. "vip": Plot VIP scores variables. "variance": Plot explained variance component. "s-plot": Plot correlation p1 pcorr1.

title: Plots for OPLS-DA ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_oplsda_res
code: # S3 method for class 'glystats_oplsda_res' autoplot(   object,   type = "scores",   y_type = "o1",   groups = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   ... )

title: Plots for OPLS-DA ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_oplsda_res
text: object glystats_oplsda_res object. type type plot, one "loadings", "scores", "vip", "variance", "s-plot". Defaults "scores". y_type plot y-axis type "scores" "loadings". Either "p2" "o1". Defaults "o1". groups factor character vector specifying group membership sample. provided, plot colored group. applicable "scores" "loadings" types. group_col character string specifying find group information. uses glystats::gly_oplsda() glyexp::experiment() get result, sample information already added result. case, can specify column name sample information tibble used coloring. provided, function try "group". ... Ignored.

title: Plots for OPLS-DA ‚Äî autoplot.glystats_oplsda_res

what: glyvis: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse ‚Äî glyvis-package
title: glyvis: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse ‚Äî glyvis-package
text: Provides unified interface visualizing glycomics data within 'glycoverse' ecosystem. Implements 'autoplot()' methods various data structures including statistical results 'glystats', experimental data 'glyexp', glycan structures 'glyrepr'. Designed rapid data exploration quality assessment rather publication-quality figure generation.

title: glyvis: Fast Visualization For Glycoverse ‚Äî glyvis-package
text: Maintainer: Bin Fu 23110220018@m.fudan.edu.cn (ORCID)

title: Boxplot ‚Äî plot_boxplot
text: Draw boxplot. Currently supported data types: glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). Boxplots log2-transformed expression values plotted, grouped group column.

title: Boxplot ‚Äî plot_boxplot
code: plot_boxplot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_boxplot(x, group_col = "group", ...)

title: Boxplot ‚Äî plot_boxplot
text: x object plotted. ... Ignored. group_col character string specifying column name sample information contains group labels. Default "group".

title: Boxplot ‚Äî plot_boxplot
text: ggplot object.

title: Correlation Plot ‚Äî plot_corrplot
text: Draw correlation matrix heatmap. Currently supported data types: glystats_cor_res: Result glystats::gly_cor(). glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). Correlation analysis first performed using glystats::gly_cor(), result plotted.

title: Correlation Plot ‚Äî plot_corrplot
code: plot_corrplot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_cor_res' plot_corrplot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_corrplot(x, stats_args = list(), ...)

title: Correlation Plot ‚Äî plot_corrplot
text: x object plotted. ... Additional arguments passed GGally::ggcorr(). stats_args list keyword arguments pass glystats::gly_cor().

title: Correlation Plot ‚Äî plot_corrplot
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot Enrichment Analysis Results ‚Äî plot_enrich
text: Draw enrichment analysis result plot. Currently supported data types: glystats_go_ora_res: Result glystats::gly_enrich_go(). glystats_kegg_ora_res: Result glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). glystats_reactome_ora_res: Result glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). Enrichment analysis first performed using glystats::gly_enrich_go(), glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(), glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(), result plotted.

title: Plot Enrichment Analysis Results ‚Äî plot_enrich
code: plot_enrich(x, type = "dotplot", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_go_ora_res' plot_enrich(x, type = "dotplot", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_kegg_ora_res' plot_enrich(x, type = "dotplot", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_reactome_ora_res' plot_enrich(x, type = "dotplot", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_enrich(x, type = "dotplot", enrich_type = "go", stats_args = list(), ...)

title: Plot Enrichment Analysis Results ‚Äî plot_enrich
text: x object plotted. type type plot, one "dotplot" (default), "barplot", "network". ... Additional arguments passed underlying functions: "dotplot": enrichplot::dotplot() "barplot": enrichplot::barplot.enrichResult() "network": enrichplot::emapplot() enrich_type type enrichment analysis, one "go" (default), "kegg", "reactome". stats_args list keyword arguments pass glystats::gly_enrich_go(), glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(), glystats::gly_enrich_reactome().

title: Plot Enrichment Analysis Results ‚Äî plot_enrich
text: ggplot object.

title: Heatmap ‚Äî plot_heatmap
text: Draw heatmap glyexp::experiment(). Heatmap log2-transformed expression values plotted. plotting, zero-variance rows columns filtered ensure robust clustering.

title: Heatmap ‚Äî plot_heatmap
code: plot_heatmap(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_heatmap(x, ...)

title: Heatmap ‚Äî plot_heatmap
text: x glyexp::experiment() object. ... arguments passed pheatmap::pheatmap().

title: Heatmap ‚Äî plot_heatmap
text: ggplot object.

title: Logo Plot ‚Äî plot_logo
text: Draw logo plot glycosites. Positions insufficient flanking amino acids padded "X". Currently supported data types: glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). Logo plot glycosylation sites plotted.

title: Logo Plot ‚Äî plot_logo
code: plot_logo(x, n_aa = 5L, fasta = NULL, tax_id = 9606L, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_logo(x, n_aa = 5L, fasta = NULL, tax_id = 9606L, ...)

title: Logo Plot ‚Äî plot_logo
text: x object plotted. n_aa number amino acids left right glycosylation site. example, n_aa = 5, resulting sequence contain 11 amino acids. fasta path FASTA file containing protein sequences. glyclean::add_site_seq() called experiment, argument can omitted. site_sequence missing fasta NULL, UniProt.ws used fetch protein sequences automatically. tax_id NCBI taxonomy ID used UniProt.ws lookups. Defaults 9606. ... Additional arguments passed ggseqlogo::ggseqlogo().

title: Logo Plot ‚Äî plot_logo
text: ggplot object.

title: OPLS-DA Plot ‚Äî plot_oplsda
text: Draw OPLS-DA scores plot. Currently supported data types: glystats_oplsda_res: Result glystats::gly_oplsda(). glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). OPLS-DA analysis first performed using glystats::gly_oplsda(), result plotted.

title: OPLS-DA Plot ‚Äî plot_oplsda
code: plot_oplsda(   x,   type = "scores",   y_type = "o1",   groups = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'glystats_oplsda_res' plot_oplsda(   x,   type = "scores",   y_type = "o1",   groups = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_oplsda(   x,   type = "scores",   y_type = "o1",   groups = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   stats_args = list(),   ... )

title: OPLS-DA Plot ‚Äî plot_oplsda
text: x object plotted. type type plot, one "loadings", "scores", "vip", "variance", "s-plot". Defaults "scores". y_type plot y-axis type "scores" "loadings". Either "p2" "o1". Defaults "o1". groups factor character vector specifying group membership sample. provided, plot colored group. applicable "scores" "loadings" types. group_col character string specifying find group information. uses glystats::gly_oplsda() glyexp::experiment() get result, sample information already added result. case, can specify column name sample information tibble used coloring. provided, function try "group". ... Ignored. stats_args list keyword arguments pass glystats::gly_oplsda().

title: OPLS-DA Plot ‚Äî plot_oplsda
text: ggplot object.

title: PCA Plot ‚Äî plot_pca
code: plot_pca(x, type = "individual", groups = NULL, group_col = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_pca_res' plot_pca(x, type = "individual", groups = NULL, group_col = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_pca(   x,   type = "individual",   groups = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   stats_args = list(),   ... )

title: PCA Plot ‚Äî plot_pca
text: x object plotted. type type plot, one "screeplot", "individual", "variables", "biplot". groups factor character vector specifying group membership sample. provided, plot colored group. applicable "individual" "biplot" types. Passed habillage paramter factoextra::fviz_pca_ind() factoextra::fviz_pca_biplot(). group_col character string specifying find group information. ... Additional arguments passed underlying factoextra functions: type = "screeplot": factoextra::fviz_screeplot(). type = "individual": factoextra::fviz_pca_ind(). type = "variables": factoextra::fviz_pca_var(). type = "biplot": factoextra::fviz_pca_biplot(). stats_args list keyword arguments pass glystats::gly_pca().

title: PCA Plot ‚Äî plot_pca

title: ROC plot ‚Äî plot_roc
text: Draw ROC curves. two groups allowed. 10 variables can plotted. Currently supported data types: glystats_roc_res: Result glystats::gly_roc(). glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). ROC analysis first performed using glystats::gly_roc(), result plotted.

title: Volcano Plot ‚Äî plot_volcano
text: Draw volcano plot. Currently supported data types: glystats_ttest_res: Result glystats::gly_ttest(). glystats_wilcox_res: Result glystats::gly_wilcox(). glystats_limma_res: Result glystats::gly_limma(). two-group comparisons supported. glyexp_experiment: Experiment created glyexp::experiment(). Differential expression analysis first performed using glystats::gly_ttest(), glystats::gly_wilcox(), glystats::gly_limma() (controlled test argument), result plotted.

title: Volcano Plot ‚Äî plot_volcano
code: plot_volcano(x, log2fc_cutoff = 1, p_cutoff = 0.05, p_col = "p_adj", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' plot_volcano(   x,   log2fc_cutoff = 1,   p_cutoff = 0.05,   p_col = "p_adj",   test = "limma",   stats_args = list(),   ... )  # S3 method for class 'glystats_ttest_res' plot_volcano(x, log2fc_cutoff = 1, p_cutoff = 0.05, p_col = "p_adj", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_wilcox_res' plot_volcano(x, log2fc_cutoff = 1, p_cutoff = 0.05, p_col = "p_adj", ...)  # S3 method for class 'glystats_limma_res' plot_volcano(   x,   log2fc_cutoff = 1,   p_cutoff = 0.05,   p_col = "p_adj",   contrast = NULL,   ... )

title: Volcano Plot ‚Äî plot_volcano
text: x object plotted. log2fc_cutoff log2 fold change cutoff. Defaults 1. p_cutoff p-value cutoff. Defaults 0.05. p_col column name p-value. Defaults "p_adj". Can also "p_val" (raw p-values without multiple testing correction). ... arguments passed EnhancedVolcano::EnhancedVolcano(). test "ttest", "wilcox", "limma". Default "limma". stats_args list keyword arguments pass glystats::gly_ttest(), glystats::gly_wilcox(), glystats::gly_limma(). contrast character string specifying contrast plot, format "group1_vs_group2". Must one contrasts result. one contrast (two-group comparison), can NULL (default).

title: Volcano Plot ‚Äî plot_volcano
text: ggplot object.

what: Objects exported from other packages ‚Äî reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages ‚Äî reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. ggplot2 autoplot

title: glyvis 0.5.0
text: plot_logo() now fetches protein sequences Uniprot automatically fasta file provided.

title: glyvis 0.4.5
text: Fix bug plot_heatmap() handle NA values. Now robust clustering method used zero-variance variables removed.

title: glyvis 0.4.4
text: Suppress harmless warnings plot_volcano() plot_pca().

title: glyvis 0.4.3
text: Fix bug plot_heatmap() always sends plot plot panel even result passed variable.

title: glyvis 0.4.2
text: Fix bug plot_volcano() correctly handle contrast argument glystats::gly_limma() results. Fix bug autoplot() method glystats::gly_limma() results work.

title: glyvis 0.4.1
text: plot_volcano() now supports glystats::gly_limma() results multiple contrasts. Use pheatmap ggplotify plot_heatmap() plot heatmaps. Remove autoplot() glystats_wgcna_res objects now. re-implemented future features.

title: glyvis 0.4.0
text: redesign plot_xxx() functions make flexible. Previously, functions accepts glyexp::experiment() object. Now, also accept corresponding glystats results, intuitive convenient. also redesign argument passing strategies plot_xxx() functions, making clear separation underlying statistical functions plotting functions.

title: glyvis 0.4.0
text: Add plot_oplsda() plot OPLS-DA plot glyexp::experiment() glystats::gly_oplsda() results. Add plot_plsda() plot PLS-DA plot glyexp::experiment() glystats::gly_plsda() results. Add plot_enrich() plot dotplot, barplot, network plot glyexp::experiment() glystats enrichment functions (glystats::gly_enrich_go(), glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(), glystats::gly_enrich_reactome()). plot_corrplot() now supports glystats::gly_cor() results. plot_pca() now supports glystats::gly_pca() results. plot_roc() now supports glystats::gly_roc() results. plot_tsne() now supports glystats::gly_tsne() results. plot_umap() now supports glystats::gly_umap() results. plot_volcano() now supports glystats::gly_ttest(), glystats::gly_wilcox(), glystats::gly_limma() results. Add stats_args parameter plot_corrplot(), plot_pca(), plot_roc(), plot_tsne(), plot_umap(), plot_volcano(), support specifying arguments underlying glystats functions. ... plot_xxx() functions passed underlying plotting functions ().

title: glyvis 0.4.0
text: Add descriptions supported data types documentation plot_xxx() functions. Fix inconsistent argument passiing plot_xxx() functions.

title: glyvis 0.3.1
text: Fix bugs introduced breaking changes glyexp 0.10.0.

title: glyvis 0.3.0
text: Add test parameter plot_volcano() specify statistical test type. Add plot_boxplot() plot grouped boxplots experiment objects. ROC curves can plotted glystats::gly_roc() results using autoplot() now. Add plot_roc() plot ROC curves directly experiment objects.

title: glyvis 0.3.0
text: Better volcano plots using EnhancedVolcano package. Fix inconsistent behaviour plotting experiment objects autoplot(). Previously, boxplots actually plotted type = "barplot". Now boxplots grouped group column plotted, faceted variables, type = "boxplot". Use rlang::check_installed() better optional dependency checking.

title: glyvis 0.2.1
text: Adapt breaking changes glystats v0.5.0.

title: glyvis 0.2.0
text: Add plot_logo() plot logo plots glycosites.

title: glyvis 0.2.0
text: Re-export autoplot() ggplot2 prevent ‚Äòfind function ‚Äúautoplot‚Äù‚Äô error ggplot2 loaded. Add Get Started vignette.

title: glyvis 0.1.2
text: Update dependencies depend release versions glycoverse packages.

title: glyvis 0.1.1
text: Fix bugs tests introduced glyexp v0.8.0.

title: glyvis 0.1.0
text: First release.
